subject: RE: [junit] test to see if the output is a string or an interger
msgSnippet: Hi, You can use try catch block. If your string return is not an alphabet , use AssertionFailedError or Throwable. Catch the exception and write fail(..) in
messageBody:
Hi,
You can use try catch block.
If your string return is not an alphabet , use AssertionFailedError or
Throwable.
Catch the exception and write fail(..) in your catch block.

Regards,
Sanjay M

-----Original Message-----
From: vivek srinivasan [mailto:wvuvivek@...]
Sent: Tuesday, November 12, 2002 1:10 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] test to see if the output is a string or an interger

Hi All,
I have a string say, Str. What my program need to test
is that the string which is returned is an alphabet .
If the string is an integer it should throw out an
error.Is there any way i can use assertEquals or any
there test methods here.
Thanks for your help in advance.
Regards,
Vivek
